CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 8 - Right to respect for private and family life
JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant was detained pending trial from DATE to DATE . During this period he corresponded with his lawyer .

CARDINAL . The following envelopes sent to the applicant by his lawyer were marked “ censored ” in handwriting , stamped with the stamp of the Gorzów Wielkopolski Regional Prosecutor ’s Office and signed in an illegible manner :
the envelope bearing a post office stamp of DATE , “ censored ” on DATE ,
the envelope bearing no post office stamp , “ censored ” on DATE ,
the envelope bearing no post office stamp , “ censored ” on DATE ,
the envelope bearing no post office stamp , “ censored ” on DATE ,
the envelope bearing no post office stamp , “ censored ” on DATE ,
the envelope bearing no post office stamp , “ censored ” on DATE ,
the envelope bearing no post office stamp , “ censored ” on DATE ,
the envelope bearing no post office stamp , “ censored ” on DATE ,
the envelope bearing no post office stamp , “ censored ” on DATE ,
the envelope bearing no post office stamp , “ censored ” on DATE ,
the envelope bearing a post office stamp of DATE “ censored ” on DATE ,
the envelope bearing a post office stamp of DATE “ censored ” on DATE ,
the envelope bearing no post office stamp , “ censored ” on DATE ,
the envelope bearing no post office stamp , “ censored ” on DATE ,
the envelope bearing no post office stamp , “ censored ” on DATE ,
the envelope bearing no post office stamp , “ censored ” on DATE ,
the envelope bearing no post office stamp , “ censored ” on DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant also submitted CARDINAL other envelopes . CARDINAL of them bear a note “ no censorship ” ( “ bez cenzury ” ) followed by the stamp of ORG and an illegible signature . They also bear post office stamps of DATE and DATE , respectively . The third one bears a stamp of ORG , a hand - written date of DATE and an illegible signature with no information as to whether the contents had been censored .

CARDINAL . The applicant submitted CARDINAL of the “ censored ” envelopes to ORG . On DATE ORG informed ORG about the incident . On DATE ORG issued an explanatory note ( “ notatka służbowa ” ) stating that in spite of the word “ censored ” written on the envelope , the applicant ’s correspondence had not been censored and a note “ censored ” on the envelope had probably been made by mistake .
CARDINAL . The applicant continued to inform the authorities about the alleged censorship of his correspondence .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG who had put her signature on the envelopes ( PERSON ) made a declaration ( “ oświadczenie ” ) stating that she had never censored the applicant ’s correspondence .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested that criminal proceedings be instituted against ORG ( PERSON ) alleging censorship of his correspondence with his lawyer .
CARDINAL . By a letter of DATE ORG informed the applicant that his request had been treated as a hierarchical complaint and that it had been found unsubstantiated .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant notified the police authorities of the offence committed by the Regional Prosecutor J.W.
CARDINAL . On DATE , in reply to the letter of DATE , the applicant stated that he had not intended to lodge a complaint but had requested the institution of criminal proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG again informed the applicant that all the applicant ’s requests for the institution of criminal proceedings against PERSON were to be treated as hierarchical complaints .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant again requested the institution of criminal proceedings against the Regional Prosecutor PERSON

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to institute criminal proceedings against PERSON stating that no offence had been found as the “ censored ” note had been probably written by mistake . On DATE the applicant appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Gorzów ORG upheld the contested decision . In its reasons for its decision the court stressed that the “ censored ” note had been written only on envelopes and not on letters and thus no evidence had been adduced that the applicant ’s correspondence had been censored . In consequence , it found that PERSON had not committed an offence of unlawful access to confidential information .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law concerning the censorship of ORG correspondence is set out in the ORG ’s judgments in the cases of Michta v. GPE , no CARDINAL , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE and PERSON v. GPE , no CARDINAL , § DATE , CARDINAL DATE .
